questions.question: The setting for Act 1, Scene 2 in Romeo and Juliet is:

choices.answer: Sunday night
The day before Juliet's birthday
The streets of Verona just after the bloody brawl
Saturday afternoon

questions.question: What are Paris and Lord Capulet discussing?

choices.answer: They are discussing ways to kill the Montagues
Paris wishing to marry Juliet
They are discussing a way to disobey the Prince's order.
They are discussing Romeo's love for Rosaline.

questions.question: The audience is thrown into the middle of the conversation in Act 1, Scene 2. This is called:

choices.answer: Linear narrative
In medias res; the scene starts in the middle of the action
Circular narrative
A flashback

questions.question: What is Lord Capulet's response to Paris' request to marry Juliet?

choices.answer: "Let two more summers wither in their pride."
Capulet wishes to marry Juliet  to another.
Capulet plans to put her in a convent.
Capulet wants Juliet to spend her life with her parents.

questions.question: "...My child hath not seen the change of fourteen years..." How old is Juliet?

choices.answer: Juliet is thirteen years old.
Juliet is fourteen years old.
Juliet is fifteen years old.
Juliet is sixteen years old.

questions.question: What does Capulet suggest  they do regarding Paris marrying Juliet?

choices.answer: He suggests they plan the wedding immediately.
Capulet replies Juliet is already engaged to another.
"Let two more summers wither in their pride..."
Capulet intends to send her to a convent in two years.

questions.question: What does Paris say in response to Capulet's suggestion?

choices.answer: He threatens to elope with Juliet for they are in love.
He is impatient and will make an offer to another girl.
Paris is willing to wait.
"Younger than she are happy mothers made."

questions.question: What is Capulet's response to Paris' "Younger than she are happy mothers made."

choices.answer: He relents and gives his consent.
"And too soon marr'd are those so early made."
Capulet angrily leaves.
Capulet offers the hand of his other daughter.

questions.question: "Earth hath swallowed all my hopes but she. She is the hopeful lady of my earth" means:

choices.answer: All his other children have died. She is his posterity.
He has lost all hope on this earth.
She is the only child he's ever had.
She is his favorite child and he cherishes her.

questions.question: "...woo her, gentle Paris, get her heart, My will to her consent is but a part" means:

choices.answer: Capulet does not wish to part with his daughter.
He will work with Paris to convince her to say yes.
He is afraid Paris might be too forceful with Juliet.
Court her and if she agrees then I will allow you to marry.

questions.question: What does Capulet invite Paris to?

choices.answer: To a secret fight between the Capulets and the Montagues.
"This night I hold an old accustomed feast."
To a party at the Montagues.
To a funeral for a friend.

questions.question: What does Capulet urge Paris to do at the party?

choices.answer: To forget Juliet
To just have fun and choose another girl
To sing and dance in competition for Juliet's hand.
To compare Juliet to the other young girls.

questions.question: "Earth-treading stars that make dark heaven light" refer to what?

choices.answer: The beautiful sky above Capulet's villa.
A meteor shower
The brilliant candles that will be shining at his party
The young beauties who will attend Capulet's party.

questions.question: "When well-apparell'd April on the heel of limping winter treads...." is an example of:

choices.answer: Personification
Allusion
Hyperbole
Irony

questions.question: What advise does Lord Capulet give Paris regarding Juliet to the other young women?

choices.answer: Like the one who has the most merit.
Juliet will be the most beautiful
Juliet must not be considered for she is too young.
Select my niece Rosaline.

questions.question: "Fresh fennel buds" refer to:

choices.answer: Delicious food!
Fresh smelling flowers!
Sweet smelling herbs!
Young beautiful women

questions.question: What errand does Capulet send the servant on?

choices.answer: To escort Paris home
To search for Romeo.
To deliver invitations to the guests
To fetch wine for the party

questions.question: What dilemma does the servant face in his task?

choices.answer: He is illiterate and cannot read the guest list.
He is too drunk to read the guest list.
He is a secret agent of the Montagues.
The servant hates Capulet and tears up the guest list.

questions.question: "A shoemaker should meddle with his yard and the tailor with his last..." means:

choices.answer: People should try different ways of doing their jobs.
People who have jobs to do should have the right tools.
People should explore beyond their occupations.
He is discussing all the different people who are invited.

questions.question: Who does the servant encounter to help him read the guest list?

choices.answer: Tybalt
Romeo and Benvolio
Juliet
The Nurse

questions.question: What name does Romeo discover on the guest list?

choices.answer: Diana
Juliet
Rosaline
His own name

questions.question: What advise does Benvolio give his friend?

choices.answer: Compare her with the other women and you will find better.
Have a good time and forget about Rosaline.
Try to flirt with Rosaline and win her heart.
Flirt with other women and make Rosaline jealous.
